description: From French cassolette, from Spanish cazoleta (“pan”).

entries.meaning: (countable) A box or vase with a perforated cover to emit perfumes.
The natural scent of a woman.
examples: I'm still bemused by the original "cassolette", which turns out to be "the natural perfume of a clean woman: her greatest natural asset after her beauty", and definitely not to be confused with a small hotpot.
